basics.name: Yixing Ke
basics.label: M.Sc. Student in Biology and Medicine
basics.summary: M.Sc. student in Biology and Medicine with a strong background in software engineering and electronic information, focusing on brain-computer interface (BCI), neural decoding, and multi-modal semantic alignment.

work.name: Southern University of Science and Technology (SUSTech)
work.summary: Conducting interdisciplinary research at the intersection of artificial intelligence, brain-computer interface, and neural decoding, with a focus on multi-modal alignment of brain signals, vision, and language.
highlights: Developed tri-modality alignment frameworks for brain signals, vision, and language under the RSVP paradigm.
Designed spatiotemporal feature fusion decoding networks for high-dimensional EEG signals.
Applied deep residual networks and attention mechanisms for semantic alignment between brain and visual representations.

publications.name: A Neuroscience-Inspired Framework for Tri-Modality Alignment of Brain Signals, Vision, and Language
publications.summary: Addresses the feature-physiological mismatch problem in neural decoding under the RSVP paradigm by proposing a neuroscience-inspired tri-modality alignment framework for brain signals, vision, and language.

projects.name: Neural Activity Information Decoding Based on Brain Imaging (CAS Strategic Priority Program)
projects.summary: Developed decoding models for visual perception based on high-dimensional spatiotemporal EEG signals within a national strategic priority program.
highlights: Designed a spatiotemporal feature fusion decoding network tailored for EEG signals.
Built a dual-stream cross-modal decoding architecture for brain-visual alignment.
Used deep residual networks to extract high-level semantic features from visual images.
Applied multi-head self-attention to capture millisecond-level temporal dynamics of brain signals.
Achieved high-precision semantic alignment in latent space via contrastive learning.

projects.name: Neuroscience-Inspired Brain-Vision-Language Tri-Modality Alignment Framework (Guangdong Provincial Key Laboratory Project)
projects.summary: Constructed a large model-driven tri-modality semantic fusion framework for brain, vision, and language in non-invasive BCI.
highlights: Built a joint embedding space for brain, vision, and language modalities.
Introduced large language models to generate fine-grained text descriptions as semantic anchors.
Enforced high-precision alignment of brain signals with visual and linguistic features via cross-modal contrastive learning.
Proposed a dynamic loss adjustment strategy to balance low-level features and high-level semantics.
Simulated perception-to-cognition processes inspired by the dual-stream visual system.

projects.name: FPGA Code Rule Checker and Circuit Display Development (National Outsourcing Project)
projects.summary: Led an undergraduate sub-project on FPGA code rule checking and circuit visualization for VHDL and Verilog.
highlights: Designed the overall scheme and managed software development and project progress.
Implemented a code rule checker for VHDL and Verilog.
Developed DAG-based topological sorting and automatic layout algorithms.
Realized real-time rendering and visualization of logic circuit diagrams corresponding to violating code segments.
Addressed the traceability problem from code to circuit in complex logic designs.

projects.name: Visual Image Feature Recognition Algorithm Based on ARCore (14th National Software Innovation Competition)
projects.summary: Developed an AR application and visual recognition algorithms for sharing and viewing stories on iconic objects via AR.
highlights: Designed and implemented an AR application for interactive storytelling based on visual features.
Implemented semantic recognition and positioning of surrounding objects using visual features and GPS information.
Participated in full-stack software R&D and algorithm design.
Won National Third Prize in the 14th National Software Innovation Competition.
